This study compare safety effectiveness two method invasive prenatal diagnosis : amniocentesis transabdominal chorionic villus sampling ( TA CVS ) .
DOC.brief_title: Prenatal Testing : Amniocentesis Versus Transabdominal Chorionic Villus Sampling ( TA CVS )
DOC.detailed_description: Amniocentesis generally perform 105 125 day post last menstrual period ( LMP ) TA CVS 63 76 day post LMP . This study compare safety accuracy transabdominal amniocentesis TA CVS , perform modify gestational age window 77 104 day post LMP . Healthy , pregnant woman 77 104 day gestation , whose indication prenatal diagnosis advance maternal age least 34 year enrollment , randomize receive either TA CVS amniocentesis follow baseline ultrasound . Eligible woman refuse randomization procedure schedule 104 day also follow . Primary outcome include fetal loss preterm delivery 196 day gestation well total fetal loss , amniotic fluid loss , gestational age delivery , perinatal morbidity , neonatal morbidity , congenital abnormality , include limb reduction defect . Success obtain diagnosis two procedure compare . One ancillary study evaluate feasibility accuracy fluorescence situ hybridization ( FISH ) rapid diagnostic method certain cytogenetic abnormality ; another collect data amniotic fluid alphafetoprotein acetylcholinesterase diagnosis neural tube defect .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Singleton pregnancy confirm baseline ultrasound At least 77 day gestation 104 day gestation confirm baseline ultrasound Exclusion Criteria Evidence `` vanish '' twin Bleeding equivalent menstrual period time pregnancy Medical history indicate serious maternal illness potential teratogenic exposure Oligohydramnios Known fetal abnormality Dating inconsistency : estimate gestation 8 day less estimated LMP , patient exclude unless interval growth ultrasound confirms normalcy pregnancy
